title: Twitter expands Safety Mode beta to more users in English-speaking countries
content:
Last year, Twitter announced Safety Mode — a feature that aims to shield users from potential spam and abuse on the platform. It’s an auto-moderation tool that detects insults, repetitive mentions, and other indicators that point at potentially unwanted interactions. Twitter has been testing the feature with a handful of beta users for some time,

The post Twitter expands Safety Mode beta to more users in English-speaking countries appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Twitter is expanding its Safety Mode beta feature to more users based in English-speaking countries, such as the US, UK, Canada, and more.
